availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Martin Van Buren Worsham (Laborer, Lexington, Fayette County)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, laborer. Kentucky native. Son of David S. Worsham and Elizabeth Worsham. Married to Lucy Gray Worsham. Married to Mary A. Worsham. Father of James B. Worsham. Laborer in Fayette County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, 7th Ward, p. 353B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Fayette County, KY, July 1863, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, p. 494C.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Kenton County Marriages, Film #001943299, p. 198-199.
